result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donovan L Walker-Hall

records.addlTxt:
At the request of defense, matter has been rescheduled. Parties notified. Defendant will be appearing by zoom. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on December 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Donovan L Walker-Hall in court, in custody.  Attorney Megan Kaldunski in court for Donovan L Walker-Hall.  Attorney Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  However, parties have reached an agreement and are prepared to proceed with plea.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:
Defendant changes pleas to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS 3 AND 4 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  Court DISMISSES OUTRIGHT ALL Habitual Criminality Repeater charges associated to Counts 1 AND 2. 

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Court further advised defendant that he will need to submit a DNA sample.  

Court vacates jury trial date and set the matter over for sentencing. Court orders the defendant remanded.  Defense informs the court that Defendant will be transitioning to a different facility and will inform the State and Court as to the location of the defendant.  Court approves Zoom appearances at next court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 11, Rm 608 CH.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.
For reasons stated off the record, court grants parties' request for adjournment. Final Pretrial scheduled for September 9, 2022, at 11:00 am.

Defendant Donovan L Walker-Hall in court, in custody.  Attorney Megan Kaldunski in court for Donovan L Walker-Hall.  Attorney Dennis Patrick Murphy in court on behalf of Francesco Mineo for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a final pretrial. Defense request for a quick status to allow time to review discovery material with the defendant. State has no objection. Case remains in trial posture. Court adjourns matter for a status conference. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Status conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: State's Motion in Limine
Received and Filed.

Attorney Megan Kaldunski in court, defendant Donovan L Walker-Hall not in court, in custody appearance waived.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference.   Defense requesting a Speedy Trial ( exp 9/22/2022).  Defense requesting a jury trial and final pretrial.   The court order the matter adjourned to Branch 25.
Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Megan Kaldunski in court, defendant Donovan L Walker-Hall not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak for Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Madeline Witte, under the student practice rule, appeared with A.D.A. for the State of Wisconsin. Court finds that case was incorrectly tabbed to Branch 4. Case re-tabbed to Branch 28 Judge Sanders. Case adjourned in Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Branch 4 down on 5-11-2022. Parties contacted to reschedule hearing. Parties agree upon new court date. Case adjourned in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss.  (Donovan L. Walker-Hall - #2022001773, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Donovan L Walker-Hall in court with Attorney Megan Kaldunski; both appear by video.  Defendant Donovan L Walker-Hall in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer T. Kotnik.   Court took judicial notice of 13CF2124.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
received and filed.
received and filed.

Attorney Thomas R. Reed in court.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Pd's office has not appointed counsel. Court asks in court if Atty Kaldunski would be able to take appointment for the PD's office. Atty Kaldunski accepts. Atty Reed advise would be able to appoint counsel. Court find cause to extend prelim for cause for reasons stated on the record. Case adjourned to prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Donovan L Walker-Hall not in court, defendant in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Preliminary hearing. State's witness is present. SPD need more time to appoint counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a State v. Lee hearing (Order to show cause) in Branch 04.  Order to show cause hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss.  (Donovan L. Walker-Hall - #2022001773, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Donovan L Walker-Hall not in court, defendant in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Donovan L Walker-Hall not in court, defendant in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  No driving during pendency of case.

Defendant Donovan L Walker-Hall in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Donovan L Walker-Hall in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Donovan L Walker-Hall appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised if DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant Court orders the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4)  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
